title: Scroll printer's ornaments
content:
hi all. i was curious as to where i would be able to find a "scroll" dingbat or typeface that has the scroll within it. to be more specific on what i'm referring to:

·they are seen a lot with cheribs and angels in neo-classical art  
·they always accompany "I (heart)" tattoos  
·the are on the back of the US dollar  
·they **rock!!!**

if anyone knows where i would be able to find them, i'd greatly appreciate it. thanx.

LS
author: ls3designs

comments.content:
thank you all for the comments. i'm really looking for something from the victorian era, something like what John Nolan mentioned with "Incognito". I do truly thank all of you for your posts. if anyone has any other suggestions, i'm definitely up for it!

LS

Dover have some, not as part of a typeface.  
 [http://search.store.yahoo.com/cgi-bin/nsearch?follow-pro=1&vwcatalog=dov...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020203620/http:/search.store.yahoo.com/cgi-bin/nsearch?follow-pro=1&vwcatalog=doverpublications&catalog=doverpublications&query=scrolls "http://search.store.yahoo.com/cgi-bin/nsearch?follow-pro=1&vwcatalog=doverpublications&catalog=doverpublications&query=scrolls")

Tim

not type, but sexy nonetheless:  
 [Banners from Ray Fenwick](http://web.archive.org/web/20131020203620/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/rayfenwick/140315488/in/set-72057594070590746/)
